org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.stats

Interface StatFunction<S,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - statistic value
    T - type of record to compute the statistic.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PairEndReadStatFunction<S,T>, SingleReadStatFunction<S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContainIndelCounter, ContainSoftclipCounter, PairIntegerTagCounter, PairIntegerTagListCounter

    public interface StatFunction<S,T>
    Common interface for statistic computation for GATKRead.

    This statistic could be applied to single or pair-end reads.

    For integration with barclay plugins, the statistic functions should have a non-arg constructor. For assessing if the arguments are legal, users should call init() before usage.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      S compute(T record)
      Gets the statistic value for the record.
      java.lang.String getStatName()
      Gets the name for the statistic.
      default void init()

      S reduce(S current, S accumulator)
      Combines a statistic generated from one pair and a running accumulator.
      default java.lang.String tableMissingFormat()
      Gets the formatted value for missing data.
      default java.lang.String tableResultFormat(S result)
      Formats the result as a string.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        default void init()
        Initialize the stat function (if needed).

        Default implementation does nothing.

        Constructors with arguments should call this method and/or throw in the same cases covered here.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the function cannot be initialize (e.g., constructor arguments are not initialized)

      • compute

        S compute(T record)
        Gets the statistic value for the record.
        Parameters:
        record - the record to compute the statistic from.
        Returns:
        the value for the statistic.

      • getStatName

        java.lang.String getStatName()
        Gets the name for the statistic.

        For several statistics in the same function, the return value should be tab-separated.

        Returns:
        statistic(s) name.

      • reduce

        S reduce(S current,
         S accumulator)
        Combines a statistic generated from one pair and a running accumulator.

        Example of implementations can be median, mean or counts.

        Parameters:
        current - the current value for the pair.
        accumulator - the accumulator. If not initialized, it is null.
        Returns:
        the reduced value.

      • tableResultFormat

        default java.lang.String tableResultFormat(S result)
        Formats the result as a string.

        For several statistics in the same function, the return value should be tab-separated.

        Default implementation returns tableMissingFormat() if result is null; otherwise, it calls result.toString().

        Parameters:
        result - the result to print.
        Returns:
        formatted result(s).

      • tableMissingFormat

        default java.lang.String tableMissingFormat()
        Gets the formatted value for missing data.

        For several statistics in the same function, the return value should be tab-separated.

        Default implementation returns "NA".

        Returns:
        formatted missing value.
